transcript.text: first of all nationalism is has always
been a myth and it was recognized to be
a myth centuries ago I mean you can read
about it in Adam Smith you know who he
wrote a book as everybody knows called
Wealth of Nations but he also pointed
out that it's nonsense there's no such
notion that the policies that he was
speaking mostly about England and he
said look the policies that are carried
out in England of the English government
are determined by what he called the
principal architects who in his day were
the merchants and manufacturers of
England and he said they doesn't use
state power to enrich themselves to
ensure that their own interests are most
peculiarly attended to as he put it
however Grievous the impact on the
people of England so in other words it's
a class policy I mean yes the nation is
mobilized but in the interest but in
class interests the interest of the
people who own the society well you know
what was obvious to Adam Smith ought to
be obvious to us uh and it would be if
we didn't have it beaten out of our
heads because it's a truism you know I
mean a 10 year old would be able to
figure it out if they just thought about
the world for a second so it takes again
a good education to drive these things
out of your head uh but it's obviously
true what Adam Smith regarded he didn't
make a big fuss about this because so
obviously true we just mentioned it but
it was obviously true then it's much
more obviously true now but it's true
that populations are mobilized in
support of the interests of the
principal architects of policy who own
the societies constantly that's why
countries go to war you know that's why
they follow a destructive domestic
policies and uh you know constructive
nationalism can react against that it
can in fact it doesn't have to be
hostile to other nationalisms it can be
cooperative with it you know people do
fall together in one or another kind of
groupings nothing wrong with that
there's no reason why one or another
those groupings has to be hostile to
another one they can recognize that
they're interested cut across them and
they can try to
cooperate with those who have the same
interests within another grouping
another nationality you know for common
like American workers and Mexican
workers have basically the same
interests they can both work within
their National
entities you know to develop policies
which will be cooperative and supportive
the other side of the class work I mean
there's nothing good or bad about
nationalism depends how to use
